name: Jiajun Jiang
content: Jiajun JIANG's Homepage HOME NEWS PUBLICATIONS PROJECTS TEACHING SERVICES HONORS 中文 Jiajun JIANG (姜 佳君) Associate Professor with TenureCo-Appointed Research Professor Software Analysis and Intelligence Lab. College of Intelligence and Computing Tianjin University Office: Room A317, Building #55, Tianjin University (Beiyangyuan Campus) Email: News 欢迎对软件分析、自动化程序调试以及程序变换相关研究感兴趣的同学(2026年研究生入学)与我联系,可以发送个人简历到我的邮箱或与我约时间交流.长期招收本科生进入实验室参与科研实习. [Sep. 11, 2025]Our ICSME 2025 paper is awarded the IEEE TCSE Distinguished Paper Award. Congrats to all. [Aug. 13, 2025]One paper is accepted by OOPSLA 2025. In this paper, we proposed an innovative silent MLIR compiler bug detection method. Congrats to Chenyao, Yongjia, and Qingchao. [May 8, 2025]One paper is accepted by ICSME 2025. In this paper, we proposed an automated program repair method that leverages fine-grained pattern mining to guide the patch generation process. Congrats to all. [Apr. 3, 2025]Two papers are accepted by the Journal First program of FSE 2025, and will be presented there. Looking forward to share our latest results about program repair and program transformation. Feel free to talk to us. Congrats to Fengjie and Zhenfei. [Mar. 8, 2025]One paper is accepted by TSE. In this paper, we have comprehensively evaluated the performance of spectrum-based fault localization techniques in the scenario of localizing bugs in deep learning libraries. Congrats to Ming and Tianjie. [Mar. 6, 2025]One paper is accepted by 《Journal of Software》. In this paper, we proposed an innovative automated testing method for QA systems, aiming at improving the logical reasoning capability of QA systems. Congrats to Qingchao, Xingjian, and Yixian [Jan. 9, 2025]One paper is accepted by TOSEM. In this paper, we proposed an innovative automated program repair by leveraing LLMs and static program analysis. The core idea is that LLM-generated patches, although not necessarily correct, offer valuable guidance for the patch generation. This is also a follow-up work of our ICSE-NIER paper. Congrats to Fengjie and Jiajun More... Education & Employment Jan, 2024 - Now, Tianjin University, Associate Professor with Tenure, Co-Appointed Research Professor, Doctoral Advisor Jul, 2020 - Dec. 2023, Tianjin University, Tenure-track Associate Professor, Master Advisor Sep, 2015 - Jul, 2020, Peking University, Doctorate Diploma of Computer Software and Theory. Advisors: Prof. Yingfei Xiong, Prof. Zhenjiang Hu and Prof. Xiangqun Chen Jul, 2019 - Oct, 2019, Research Intern at Microsoft Research Asia, DKI (Data, Knowledge, Intelligence) Group. Mentor: Qingwei Lin Jan, 2019 - May, 2019, The University of Texas at Dallas, USA, Visiting Research Scholar under the supervision of Prof. Lingming Zhang Jun, 2017 - Dec, 2017, The University of Newcastle, AU, Visiting Ph.D. Student under the supervision of Prof. Hongyu Zhang Sep, 2011 - Jul, 2015, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Bachelor Diploma of Computer Science and Technology Research Interest Automated Program Repair : finding and repairing defects to make programs conform to the given specification. Fault Localization : localizing buggy code in programs identified by some test cases in programs. ML/DL Debugging : improving the performance of ML/DL systems. Bug Detection : detecting unknown potential bugs to improve the quality of software. Program Transformation : focusing on API adaptation, program migration and improving the usability of general transformation techniques. [TIPS : Here are a collection of representative papers (partial papers published before 2020) for beginners in the research fields of Fault Localuzation, Program Repair, and Program Synthesis. More learning resources about program repair are available Here.] Publications [Google Scholar | DBLP] Note: The authors marked with "#" are equal contributors to the paper and their names are sorted in alphabetic order by last or first name, marked with "*" are corresponding authors.
